original: The Web Service is a standard software system used for communication between two devices (client and server) over the network. Web services provide a common platform for various applications written in different languages to communicate with each other over the network.
result: A web service is a software system utilized for communication between two devices, usually a client and server, across a network. Its objective is to facilitate different applications written in different programming languages to interact with one another. Web services serve as a universal platform that enables various applications to communicate over a network.

original: A web service is used to communicate among various applications by using open standards such as HTML, XML, WSDL, and SOAP. You can also use C# to develop new web services on Windows invokes from your web application that is based on Java Server Pages (JSP) and runs on Linux.
result: A web service facilitates communication between different applications using open standards like HTML, XML, WSDL, and SOAP. This means you can create a Solaris-based Java web service which can be accessed by a Windows-based Visual Basic program. Similarly, with the use of C#, new web services can be created on Windows and called from a Linux-based web application using Java Server Pages (JSP).

original: A consumer of a web service is not tied to that web service directly. The web service interface can change over time without compromising the client's ability to interact with the service. A tightly coupled system implies that the client and server logic are closely tied to one another, implying that if one interface changes, the other must be updated. Adopting a loosely coupled architecture tends to make software systems more manageable and facilitates simpler integration between different systems.
result: When using a web service as a consumer, it's beneficial if the system is designed in a loosely coupled architecture. This type of architecture allows for changes to be made to the web service interface without affecting the client's ability to interact with the service. In contrast, a tightly coupled system means that changes made to the interface would require the client to update their system as well. Adopting a loosely coupled architecture can make software systems easier to manage and enable seamless integration between different systems.

original: Using XML eliminates any networking, operating system, or platform binding. So Web Services based applications are highly interoperable application at their core level.
result: XML is a versatile technology for building Web Services that eliminates the need for specific networking, operating system, or platform requirements. This feature makes applications based on Web Services highly interoperable as it removes any binding to a particular technology.

original: Synchronicity is used to bind the client to the execution of the service. In synchronous invocations, the client blocks and waits for the service to complete its operation before continuing. On the other hand, synchronous operations facilitate a client to invoke a service and then execute different functions.
result: Synchronous invocation is a mechanism that links the client with the execution of a service. It requires the client to wait for the service to complete its operation before resuming its own tasks. In contrast, asynchronous operations allow clients to initiate a service and carry out other functions while the service executes in the background.

original: Communication protocol refers to the protocols which were used to transmit information over the web. By using Transport protocols, applications from the different background can quickly communicate with each other without knowing the inside functioning of the various systems. HTTP (Hyper-Text Transfer Protocol) can be used to implement a SOAP message whereas FTP (File Transfer Protocol) can be used as the reliable transport mechanism. SMTP and BEEP can also be used for transport mechanism.
result: Communication protocol is the set of rules or guidelines that define how data can be transferred over a network. By utilizing transport protocols, various applications can effectively share information with each other without needing to understand each other's internal processes. These transport protocols can include HTTP, FTP, SMTP, and BEEP, among others, which serve as reliable channels for transmitting data across the web. Depending on the specific requirements, developers can choose the best protocol for the task at hand.

original: SOAP message is not tied to any protocol. It can use any of the open Transport protocol.
result: A SOAP message is not restricted to a specific protocol and can utilize any available open Transport protocol.

original: The terms "Platform independent" and "Diverse Application" were related to each other because XML-RPC uses HTTP for transporting SOAP messages over the web. So because it is Platform independent, it leads to the diverse application capable of accessing the web services.
result: The concepts of "Platform independent" and "Diverse Application" are interconnected when it comes to XML-RPC. This is because XML-RPC utilizes the widely accepted HTTP protocol for transmitting SOAP messages across the internet. As HTTP is a universal standard protocol for exchanging data on the Web, XML-RPC's use of it ensures that it can function on multiple platforms, making it Platform independent. As a result, XML-RPC enables a diverse range of applications that have access to web services.
